data.event: At the time of the 2006 census, the permanent population was 4,827, an increase of 423 since 2001.

event.title: now Clyde.) Many orchards were destroyed

data.event: (The "Upper Township" was Dunstan, now Clyde.) Many orchards were destroyed in the 1980s as a result of construction, 10 km upriver, of the Clyde High Dam, which is the country's third largest hydroelectric power station.
